title: TikTok Content Strategy for Business
source: Mastering Short-Form Videos: TikTok Techniques with Keenya Kelly
outcome: Create viral-worthy TikTok/Reels content that generates leads and sales for your business

inputs.name: business_niche
inputs.description: Your business category (e.g., branding, coaching, hair care)

inputs.name: target_audience
inputs.description: Who you're trying to reach (age, interests, pain points)

inputs.name: lead_magnet_link
inputs.description: URL to your opt-in or lead capture page

capabilities_needed.description: Edit videos with jump cuts, captions, and effects
Capture leads and nurture them via email

steps.details: Go to TikTok search (magnifying glass, upper right). Type 1-2 words describing what you do. Watch the top-performing content. Bookmark videos that resonate with you. Note what topics, hooks, and formats work best.
steps.output: List of 10-20 content ideas and successful formats in your niche

steps.details: TikTok/Reels allow more creativity than LinkedIn or Facebook. You don't have to dance or be goofy, but understand what's working. Watch how others adapt trends for business purposes.
steps.output: Understanding of platform norms and creative possibilities

steps.details: List out everything your target audience deals with daily. What frustrations do they have? What scenarios happen to them regularly? These become your content topics.
steps.output: List of 20+ relatable scenarios for your audience

steps.details: You have 1-1.5 seconds to stop the scroll. Your hook can be: text on screen, the first image they see, or the first words you say. Make it compelling enough that they MUST watch.
Start directly with your hook - no 'Hey guys!' or introductions. Keep it short (15-60 seconds ideal). Use jump cuts every 3-5 seconds to maintain attention. Change scenes/locations if possible.
Add captions (80% watch on mute). Add jump cuts between segments. Use trending sounds if relevant. Keep text readable and on-brand.
Include a link in your bio to capture leads. Use platform-specific tracking links to know where leads come from. Don't focus on making money from the video - focus on getting leads.
steps.output: Video with clear path to lead capture

steps.details: Post to TikTok, then repurpose to Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and Facebook Reels. Same content, multiple platforms.
When you see a trending sound or format, ask: 'How can I make this about my business?' Take the trend template and add your business-relevant text overlay or scenario.
Once someone opts in from your link, sell them via email sequences. The video generates leads, the email converts them to customers.

estimated_time: 2-3 hours per week for content creation
key_principles: People don't buy from videos - videos generate leads, email converts to sales
80% of viewers watch on mute - always use captions
You have 1-1.5 seconds to stop the scroll
Keep videos as short as possible - don't pad for length
Your audience IS on TikTok - they just might not be posting
Consistency beats virality - focus on leads, not follower count
